subject: Business
title: Safety Stock: The Insurance Buffer
description: A quick win: understand Safety Stock: The Insurance Buffer.

hook.text: You sell 100 widgets a week. You keep 100 extra on the shelf just in case. Those 100 extras are safety stock.

buildup.text: Safety stock is extra inventory held to protect against unexpected demand spikes or supply delays.

discovery.text: The right amount depends on demand variability, lead time variability, and your acceptable stockout risk.

twist.text: Too much safety stock ties up cash. Too little means empty shelves and lost customers.

climax.text: Walmart uses real-time demand sensing to dynamically adjust safety stock levels across 4,700 stores.

punchline.text: Safety stock costs money. Stockouts cost customers.

quiz.question: What determines the right amount of safety stock?
options: Demand variability, lead time variability, and acceptable stockout risk
The number of employees in the company
